metadata.titel_preek: Little Resurrections After the Big One
metadata.bijbeltekst: Acts 3-4 (referenced as Psalm 23 in title, but text is Acts)

locutie.beschrijving: A narrative retelling of Peter and John before the Sanhedrin, focusing on the healing of the lame beggar and the subsequent confrontation with imperial power.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong socio-political reading of the text, emphasizing the conflict between 'unauthorized' divine power and 'imperial' control.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting historical/narrative facts and interpreting them through a political lens, with a late shift toward invitation.
voorbeelden: The apostles have performed a mini-resurrection.
This is the one whom God raised from the dead.
I invite you to think about this.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To inspire a sense of social agency and awareness of divine power outside of state structures.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Mentioned as a historical fact regarding Peter, but not explicitly invoked for the current event of the sermon.

voorbeelden: The managers of the Roman Empire were made nervous.
This is the local power structure.
Easter resurrection is an act that defies control.
Imagine that it is also a venue for resurrection.
I invite you to think about this.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Weak; the preacher commits to an invitation to 'think' rather than God committing to an action.

voorbeelden: You also are a child of the big wonder of Easter.
declaratieven.autoriteit: Moderate; uses the 'indicative of grace' but lacks the explicit 'I declare to you' formula.

indicatoren: Extensive retelling of Acts 3-4 in the third person.
Theological abstraction ('The big resurrection is the basic truth').
Focus on 'what they did' rather than 'what is happening now'.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes a spectator of a historical/political drama rather than a participant in a current divine act.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Generic and descriptive rather than personal and binding.
voorbeelden: You also are a child of the big wonder of Easter.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address only appears in the final section.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to assign identity ('You are a child').

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominates the narrative about Peter, John, and the Empire.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: High; creates a 'lecture' feel for 80% of the duration.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Theological principles about power and resurrection.

actueel_present.gebruik: The table and the current invitation.

voorbeelden: This is an ancient story... I invite you to think about this.
foutief_patroon.probleem: The move to action (Directive) is based on information (Assertive) rather than a new reality (Declarative).

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Brief shift at the end: Assertive (Easter) -> Declarative (You are a child) -> Directive (Defy status quo).
voorbeelden: You also are a child... You also are authorized... You also are invited to defy.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The Declarative is present but buried under the weight of the preceding Assertives.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because this power for life surges among us... you are invited to defy.
voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: The apostles performed a mini-resurrection... (no immediate link to the hearer's power until the end).

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions primarily as a socio-political commentary on a biblical text. It 'talks about' resurrection as a category of power rather than 'performing' resurrection through the word.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Analysis of the 'unauthorized movement' vs 'imperial surveillance'.
sterke_punten.effect: Provides a fresh, challenging perspective on the text's context.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Sections I, II, and III are almost entirely 3rd person past tense.
zwakke_punten.probleem: The hearer is an observer of Peter's boldness, not a recipient of Christ's power.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The 'event' is delayed until the very end. Most of the sermon is a report on a past event.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: Lacks the 'Creative Word' (Declarative) that brings what it says into being until the final sentences.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Implicitly, God is the source of the 'juices of life,' but the preacher speaks more as a social analyst.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Weak; the preacher acts more as a 'witness to a witness' (Peter).
tekstueel_bewijs: I invite you to think about this.
He was 'filled with the Holy Spirit'.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Low; the sermon is a preparation for the 'table of life' rather than being a meal in itself.
tekstueel_bewijs: As we come to this table of life...

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Shift from 'They did/He was' to 'Christ does/You are'.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The apostles have performed a mini-resurrection.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: In the name of the risen Christ, I declare that a mini-resurrection is happening in your life today.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from historical report to present-tense sacramental event.

voorbeeldzinnen: God promises you today that the same Spirit that filled Peter is being poured into you now.
When the authorities look at your life, do they see an unauthorized power?

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The imperative 'defy' lacks a strong present-tense indicative foundation.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Ground the 'defy' in the 'I authorize you' declarative.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has brilliant locutionary insight; by shifting the illocutionary force from 'talking about' Peter to 'addressing' the congregation with the same authority Peter used, this could become a truly sacramental event.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' or 'appeal'; SAT reveals the sermon is failing not psychologically, but ontologically as a Declarative act.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric would praise the 'Empire' metaphor; SAT critiques the lack of illocutionary 'binding' of God to the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT identifies that the sermon's power is 'trapped' in the 3rd person, preventing the 'event' from occurring until the final 10%.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The apostles have performed a mini-resurrection.
You also are a child of the big wonder of Easter.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Strong, but late in the sermon.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'indicative of the past' rather than the 'indicative of the present grace'.
